meanings.definition: To make distinct or separate from others.
meanings.sent1: She wanted to individualise her belongings by adding her name to each item.
meanings.sent2: It is important to individualise each student's learning experience to cater to their needs.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to individualise the dish by adding a special secret ingredient.
meanings.sent4: The artist's goal was to individualise each painting, making them stand out in the gallery.
meanings.sent5: The tailor worked hard to individualise each outfit, ensuring they fit perfectly.

meanings.definition: To give a unique or personal character to.
meanings.sent1: He tried to individualise his room by decorating it with his favorite colors.
meanings.sent2: The author aimed to individualise each character in the story, making them memorable.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes always manage to individualise even the most common situations.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had the power to individualise her face, making her easily recognizable.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's approach was to individualise feedback for each student, recognizing their strengths.
